*[[Kabir]] - 15th century mystical poet and founder of the [[Kabirpanthi]]. Born to a Hindu [[Brahmin]] widow but adopted and raised as Muslim by a childless Muslim couple, later denouncing both Hinduism and Islam.<ref>[http://www.crl.edu/focus/Spr05litGems.asp?issID=3 Rare Literary Gems: The Works of Kabir and Premchand at CRL]</ref>.<ref>[http://www.hinduwebsite.com/sacredscripts/other/kabir.asp The songs of Kabir]</ref>
+
*[[Kabir]] - 15th century mystical poet and founder of the [[Kabirpanthi]]. Born to a Hindu [[Brahmin]] widow but adopted and raised as Muslim by a childless Muslim couple, later denouncing both Hinduism and Islam.<ref>[http://www.crl.edu/focus/Spr05litGems.asp?issID=3 Rare Literary Gems: The Works of Kabir and Premchand at CRL]</ref><ref>[http://www.hinduwebsite.com/sacredscripts/other/kabir.asp The songs of Kabir]</ref>
* [[Musaylimah]] - Prophet of the [[Banu Hanifa]] tribe who lived during and after the lifetime of [[Muhammad|Prophet Muhammad]].<ref>[http://al-islam1.org/message/62.htm A short biography of Musaylimah] "He was one of those persons, who came to Madina in the tenth year of migration and embraced Islam. However, after his return to his birthplace he himself claimed to be a prophet and some simple-minded and also some fanatical persons responded to his call".</ref>
* [[Musaylimah]] - Prophet of the [[Banu Hanifa]] tribe who lived during and after the lifetime of [[Muhammad|Prophet Muhammad]].<ref>[http://al-islam1.org/message/62.htm A short biography of Musaylimah] "He was one of those persons, who came to Madina in the tenth year of migration and embraced Islam. However, after his return to his birthplace he himself claimed to be a prophet and some simple-minded and also some fanatical persons responded to his call".</ref>
*[[Dwight York]] - [[African American]] author, black supremacist leader, musician, convicted child molester and founder of the religious doctrine called [[Nuwaubianism]].<ref>[http://www.trincoll.edu/depts/csrpl/RINVol9No1/Cult%20Fighting%20in%20Middle%20Georgia.htm Cult Fighting in Middle Georgia]</ref>
*[[Dwight York]] - [[African American]] author, black supremacist leader, musician, convicted child molester and founder of the religious doctrine called [[Nuwaubianism]].<ref>[http://www.trincoll.edu/depts/csrpl/RINVol9No1/Cult%20Fighting%20in%20Middle%20Georgia.htm Cult Fighting in Middle Georgia]</ref>
